Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Dwight hands Jim a piece of paper] Oh, what's this?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is a demerit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [reads demerit] "Jim Halpert, tardiness." Ugh. I love it already.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You've gotta learn, Jim. You are second in command, but that does not put you above the law.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I understand. And I also have lots of questions, like, what does a demerit mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] Let's put it this way. You do not want to receive three of those.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Lay it on me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Three demerits and you'll receive a citation.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now that sounds serious.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, it is serious. Five citations and you're looking at a violation. Four of those and you'll receive a verbal warning. Keep it up, and you're looking at a written warning. Two of those, that'll land you in a world of hurt... in the form of a disciplinary review written up by me and placed on the desk of my immediate superior.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which would be me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is correct.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, I want a copy on my desk by the end of the day or you will receive a full disadulation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's a dis... what's that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, you don't want to know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [door opens] Hey, Phyllis. You all right?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think I just got flashed.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? Really?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: In the parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [jumps out of his chair and runs for the door] Move!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, I'll call the real police.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What happened? What can I do to help?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on the phone] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'll check the web.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on the phone] Thank you. [hangs up the phone] The police are on it. They say they've already had three calls.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Phyllis] Can you tell us what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Um... I was walking to the building and this man asked me for directions. And he was holding a map. And when I walked over, he had it out... on the map.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phyllis. You're a married woman.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: The guy was just hanging brain. I mean, what's all the fuss?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: If that's flashing, then lock me up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] It's just, like, so creepy.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [whispering] Yeah. [Pam and Ryan whispering]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's happening?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, some guy exposed himself to Phyllis in the parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? Is she OK?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, Bob Vance took her for a walk to calm down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. [deep breath] Phyllis, you say? [snorts] Hmm. [suppressed laugher]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What is so funny?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... I mean did he even see Pam? Or, uh... Karen from behind?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm guessing not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing softly] I'm sorry. It's pretty funny when you think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm... not really, no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's disgusting and demeaning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, OK. Masters of comedy. A guy dropped his pants. Have you ever been to the circus? [everyone glares] OK. [Michael puts his finger through his pant's zipper] He's back! [laughs] OK. Hmm. [babbling with his coat pulled closed] Waagh! [flashes everyone]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, what's going on? There's a police car in the...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What? Oh. [makes descending scale noise as his finger goes down]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Phyllis got flashed. It's, uh... [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't think laughing about it is an appropriate response.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, come on. We are laughing at Phyllis, but she's not even here, so no harm, no foul.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I don't think the women in this office -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Incidentally, where were you during all of this? Maybe you're the flasher.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I was at a parent-teacher conference.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh-huh. Prove it. Let's see your penis. [everyone is shocked] [exhales]I... you know, as that was coming out of my mouth, I knew that it was wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In all the excitement, I forgot that my primary goal is to keep people safe. Women can't have fun if they don't feel safe. For example, Jan and I have a safe word in case things go too far. Foliage. And if one of us says that word, the other one has to stop. Although last time... she pretended she didn't hear me.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] Michael, ...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...come over after work tonight, OK? I miss your body.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know. I feel... I drive a lot. I'm spending a fortune on gas and tolls -

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I'll give you $200. And if I get up before you, I'll leave it on the dresser.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, that... I don't know. That makes me kind of uncomfortable.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... uh, well, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You know whatever. Just let my assistant know if you're coming over so he can get more vodka, OK? Hunter, are you on?

Quote.Speaker: Hunter
Quote.Text: [on speakerphone] You got it, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Employees of this office are very small and delicate. Deserve protection from local pervs. Better 1,000 innocent men are locked up than one guilty man roam free.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [exhales] I am sick over this thing. Those people out there are clearly afraid. And that can't happen. Not in my house.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Agreed. Let me show you what I've been working on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [lays a folder full of pictures on Michael's desk] There are several penises there I'd love Phyllis to run her eyes over. You know, see if we can catch this pervert.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is the last thing that Phyllis needs to see right now, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Look at that one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, are those your pants? That's a Polaroid. [Dwight takes the Polaroid and crumples it in his hand]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Attention, everybody. Dwight has something he would like to say.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Due to a recent incident involving Phyllis, a man, a map, and his penis - I think you know what I'm referring to - Michael has authorized me to form an emergency anti-flashing task force.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [raises hand] Question. Won't that interfere with your other task forces?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Answer: No, because this is being given priority one. This is a petition for the business park to upgrade their security cameras as well as install two floodlights in the parking lot. And I know... I know what you're thinking. [Pam nods] Won't that just shed more light on the penises? But that is a risk we have to take. Pam. You can draw, kind of. Why don't you work with Phallus on drawing a picture of the exposer that I can post around the community?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phallus?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phyllis, sorry. I've got penises on the brain. Back to work, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't often miss Roy. But I can tell you one thing. I wish someone had flashed me when I was with Roy. Because that would have been the ass-kicking of the year. [small laugh] Especially if it had been Jim. He would not have wanted me to have seen Jim's... Whoo, I am... I am saying a lot of things.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I didn't really get a good look.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's OK. I don't feel like answering phones.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey, did you guys see this memo that Dwight sent out? [reads memo] "Women will be sent home if they wear makeup or heels exceeding 1/4 inch. Females are not allowed to speak to strangers unless given written authorization by Dwight Schrute." This is ridiculous.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention. I am removing all bananas from the kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Dwight, this memo that you distributed is insulting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Desperate times call for desperate measures.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [reads memo] "Sleeves down to the wrists, buttoned-up collars, and muted colors." Nobody dress like that. [camera pans over to Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, you know something, Dwight? We are not the terrorists. Why don't you just take these women, put 'em in a burlap sack, and hit 'em with a stick? Because that's what you're doing. I celebrate these women. They deserve the right to dress as they please. If Pam wants to show more cleavage, she should be able to. I encourage that.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Look, it's really simple. We just want you guys to treat us with respect.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See? That's what we're talking about. Did you hear that, Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes. Did you hear that, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, Dwight. Respect. R-E-S-P-svee-T. Find out what it means to me. All right, you know what? That's it. Conference room, five minutes. Women's appreciation.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait a second, how are you qualified for that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know, James. Did I come from a woman? Have I slept with a woman? More than one?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [eating banana] Mm, less than three.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is not current.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? Why doesn't Oscar run the meeting? He's a homosexual.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why don't you run the meeting? You play with dolls.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Those are collectible action figures and they're worth more than your car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I am the expert. I will conduct it. I know the crap out of women.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I, um... would like to apologize for all of the men who thought this was a laughing matter.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Are we still discussing this? I say again, what is the big deal?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nobody likes to be flashed. When Meredith flashed me at that Christmas party, I nearly vomited.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I don't remember doing that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What a surprise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, no catfights. Please. Let's - my point is... my point is... a penis, when seen in the right context, is the most wonderful sight for a woman. But in the wrong context, it is like a monster movie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alien. Blagh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are...? Shut it. Shut. Up. OK, so what I want to engage us in today is a hardcore discussion about women's problems and issues and situations. Magazines and TV shows and movies portray women as skinny, tall goddesses. Well, look around. Are women like that? No. No, they are not. [points to Pam] Even the hot ones aren't really that skinny. So what does that say? That says that you women are up against it. And it is criminal. Society doesn't care. Society sucks. I don't even consider myself a part of society. FYI. Because I am so angry over all of this.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If it were up to me, you ladies would be the fashion models.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes, Andy. Then the fashion models could come here and work with me.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What you're saying is extremely misogynistic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. Thank you. That was not necessary, but I appreciated it. And I proves my point. Women can do anything.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: I'm saying that you're being sexist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I'm being misogynistic. That is insane. I am not being sexist.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That - it's the same thing.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: When I got my hair cut short, you asked me if I was a lesbian.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because wha... that was one possible explanation as to why you got that haircut.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And when we get mad, you always ask us if we're on our periods.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have to know whether you're serious or not.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I wish I could menstruate.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If I could menstruate, I wouldn't have to deal with idiotic calendars anymore. I'd just be able to count down from my previous cycle. Plus, I'd be more in tune with the moon and the tides.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Can we just get back to work?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ye - OK, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is not work talk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're right. You're right, you're right. And you know why? It's because of where we are. This is a masculine environment. We need to find a place where you feel comfortable. You know where we're gonna go? The Steamtown Mall. [Kelly gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Frankly, it's kind of insulting. But I have a bunch of stuff I need to return in my car. So... I could do that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Malls are just awful and humiliating. They're just store after store of these horrible salespeople making a big fuss out of an adult shopping in a junior's section. There are petite adults who are sort of... smaller who need to wear... maybe a kids' size 10.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, let's go, ladies of Dunder-Mifflin. Hey, we should have a calendar printed up. Pam, put that in my good idea folder. [Pam nods] Let's go!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have you finished with the sketch?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm, doesn't seem like the type.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, Phyllis got a good look.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Pam's sketch looks like Dwight with a mustache, but without his glasses] I plan on plastering this pervert's face everywhere. You can run, but you cannot hide.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [tires screeching] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Meredith, slow down! We're not gonna get there any faster if we're dead.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thanks. I know how to drive. [dumps the crumbs from a bag of chips she was eating into her mouth and throws it out the window]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. You really shouldn't litter.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: My car, my rules.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim. You wanna go in the women's bathroom?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. Thank you, though.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You aren't curious?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not really. I've seen a bathroom before.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, but... it's every guy's fantasy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you mean a girl's locker room. And in the fantasy, there's usually girls in it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [quietly] Yeah. I'm going in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Go crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [in women's bathroom] Oh... my... God.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I really appreciate your letting me work alongside you so closely today.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course you do, moon face. That's because you're a preppy freak, you're the office pariah, and nobody likes you. So start hanging these all around the building.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This guy looks like a real deviant.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, duh. That's why we gotta catch him. Start hanging those.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Aye, aye, Cap'n.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: More like, "Aye, aye, General."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Meredith parking the car] I don't think she's gonna make it. Don't think she's gonna make it - [metal scraping]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: It's a little too tight. I'm gonna find another spot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Many women are competent drivers. [scraping] OK. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [marks Scranton with a red pushpin on a map of Pennsylvania and exhales] This is what we know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [in women's bathroom] Well, I stand corrected. This is pretty cool.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, uh... where'd you decide to take Karen tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Anna Maria's.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What's the occasion?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Six-month anniversary. What?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Nothing - I think, uh, we all kinda thought you guys were just, like, hooking up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, we've been dating for six months.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, she might mention an email that I wrote a while back, um -

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, right. I remember that one. She read it to me. She said she's not really ready to date somebody in the office, but she really likes you as a friend.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I figured. It's cool. I don't - I wouldn't want to be in an office relationship anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Hope nobody's on a diet.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Thanks, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome. You're welcome, you're welcome. OK. So, let's dish.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you want to dish about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Anything you guys want. This is your time. [everyone is silent or continues to eat, Michael exhales] Mm. What is a Pap smear? Or is it "shmear?" Like the cream cheese.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK. New topic. Kelly, how are things with Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Awesome. Um, awful, I mean. But, uh, sometimes awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What, um... what do you think of role-play?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, it can be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah? Well, Jan has this schoolgirl fantasy.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: It's a pretty common one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I just... I feel uncomfortable wearing the dress.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: OK. I'm gonna be at the doll store.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sometimes, the clothes at GapKids are just too flashy. So I'm forced to go to the American Girl store and order clothes for large colonial dolls.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, you shouldn't do anything that you're uncomfortable with.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jan says anything that doesn't scare us is not worth doing. I don't know. Maybe we're different people. I like cuddling and spooning and she likes videotaping us during sex.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [groans] And then watching it back right afterward to improve my form.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: That is not healthy behavior.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's not that bad. The worst part is that she shows it to her therapist and they discuss it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, you need to get out of this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, she's... she's fooling around. It's a woman thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, normal women don't do stuff like that. This is bad. [Karen nods and Michael looks like he's about to start crying]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... No, it's all right. I'm OK. I'm OK. [sniffing] You guys... what are we gonna do about Jan? [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Read the pros first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. Jan is smart. Uh, successful. Good clothes. Hot. Perfect skin. Nice butt.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: She does have very nice clothes.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: OK, OK. Um, cons.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cons. Wears too much makeup. Breasts:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, I cannot believe this yogurt has no calories.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No one said it has no calories.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, guys. I want to do something nice for you, because you did something so nice for me earlier. I want you to go in there. I want you to buy one item on me as a thank-you. [Kelly sprints inside Victoria's Secret] Come on. Get in here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's face it, most guys are from the Dark Ages. They're caveman. And they like a woman to be showing her cleavage and to be wearing 8-inch heels, and to be wearing, um, see-through underpants. But... for me, a woman looks best when she is just absolutely naked.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [in women's bathroom] This is so great, huh? We should do this much more often.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I-I think we hang out an appropriate amount of time.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What are you doing in here? This is the women's room.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You're in here.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I pay for that privilege. [goes into stall]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [all get up to leave] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [wearing headphones and speaking loudly] I'm a pretty normal guy. I do one weird thing. I like to go in the women's room for number two. I've been caught several times and I have paid dearly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm. You don't want anything? My treat. Some panties or... pick a thong or... G-string. T-back. Get a nice bra. Padded bra. See-through, push-up, lace? Thigh-high? Bustier? Any - it just - you know what, I would love to buy you a fresh set of underwear.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Phyllis. What do you think? Too much?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Jim's gonna love it. [Karen giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm kind of in-between boyfriends right now. So I don't need anything sexy. But I do need some new hand towels. I figure I can cut up this robe.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [in the car] Slower. Slower. Meredith. [Michael's cell phone ringing My Humps] Slow it up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Oh, no. [inhales sharply] It's Jan. What do I do?

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Answer it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't answer it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, it stopped.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [bang] Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [tires screeching] Crap.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [snickers at Pam's sketch] That is pretty cool.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Michael, you know how to, um -change a wheel, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah. Yep. Um... Could somebody grab me the lever, and I will...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Here, uh... Meredith? Why don't you put your hazards on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, get your hazards on for safety. Let's see. [takes off his coat and tosses it aside] There we go! [Pam brings over the jack and lug wrench] Good. Yes, we have the... all right. [tries the use the jack to loosen the lug nuts]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think I've got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you have a... a crescent? A crescent Allan?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think we really need that, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh... you know what? I'm going to... you take care of that. I'm gonna do traffic... detail.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, I changed a tire today. All by myself. This bathrobe's already coming in handy. [Meredith honking] Coming!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Think we'll find him?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, I do. 'Cause justice never rests.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [pulls a candy bar from his coat pocket] Halvsies?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Wholesies. [snatches the candy bar]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Listen, man, I really appreciate you letting me shadow you today. I feel like I learned a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Natch. [bites off a lot of candy bar]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yep. If you don't mind, I think I'll hang some of these posters around my neighborhood. Schools, post office, et cetera.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know, I may have underestimated you. You're not a total ass. [coughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, I am really going to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good luck, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what? I need my girls with me. Pam, Karen, even Phyllis. Come on. Let's do this. Let's do it. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: OK, remember, be strong.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love you guys. Now I'm getting her voicemail.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't leave a -

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [leaving a message] Hey, Jan. It's me, Michael. I'm just calling to say that I think we need a little break, permanently. And, uh, I know everybody says this, but I-I wanna remain friends. Or at least business associates who get along. Oh, just so you know, it's not me, it's you. [Jan walks in] OK, buddy. Somebody just walked in. I have to go. Um, so I'll talk to you later.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael... [clears throat] I was, um... I was really unhappy with our conversation earlier. And I... I just - I couldn't stop thinking about it. So I decided that I would drive down here and apologize to you in person. So... [takes Michael's hand] I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So... we're good?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Abso-fruit-ly.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [cell phone vibrates] Oh. Hold on, I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... No...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: One second. Oh! It's from you. Uh, you wanna grab some dinner?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK. [voice on phone] "It's me, Michael. I'm just calling to say that I think we need a little break, permanently. And, uh, I know everybody says this, but I want..."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe some Italian. [voice on phone] "... to remain friends. Or at least business associates -" [Jan takes the phone away from her ear] Chinese? [voice on phone] "who get along. Oh, just so you know, it's not me, it's you. OK, buddy."

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh. [door closes]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Any man who says he totally understands women is a fool. Because they are un-understandable. There's a wishing fountain at the mall. And I threw a coin in for every woman in the world and made a wish. I wished for Jan to get over me. I wished for Phyllis, a plasma TV. I wished for Pam to gain courage. I wished for Angela, a heart, and for Kelly, a brain. "Michael, how can you appreciate women so much but also dump one of them?" You mean, how can I be so illogical and flighty and unpredictable and emotional? Well, maybe I learned something from women after all.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [phone rings] Dunder-Mifflin paper/sex predator hotline, this is Dwight Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. It's Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, what are you doing? I'm busy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you're not. I'm looking right at you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ugh. I'm hanging up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't. [quietly] I have information about the sex predator.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have information about the sex predator?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I saw him two minutes ago.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In the women's bathroom, above the sink.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [hangs up and runs to the women's bathroom] Anti-flashing task force! Above the sink. Above the sink. Hmm. [sees himself in the mirror with two black marks on the mirror making a mustache, removes his glasses and figures it out] PAM!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So how are you liking the Wall Street Journal subscription?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Love it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Are you reading it everyday, like we decided you would?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, yes, I am.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Good, good, it's the best business reporting isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah, it's okay. Its just, I don't think the cartoons are very funny.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Wait, wait, what cartoons?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The a cartoon that goes with each article. This one says Mel Karmazin? I don't, I don't know. I guess I get it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: [Sigh]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We should really start recycling.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Right uh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hey, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Phyllis got flashed in the parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [Screams]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Okay, you need to stop that right now.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: Phyllis, you okay? You sure?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey good lookin', what ya got cookin'?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I got nothing cooking, it's cooked. It's borscht and its served cold.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey listen, I'm sure everyone's already told you but, your presentation out there, was pretty inspiring stuff. Must be nice being a woman around here, knowing they have a protector in you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you are trying to kiss my ass, I would not suggest it. Believe me, you do not want to kiss this ass.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Borscht, according to Dwight it's best served cold. You know what else is best served cold? Yeah, gazpacho. You see what I'm doing? I am establishing a mutual love of cold soups. This is the first step in my plan to win Dwight's trust.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I should make you my vichyssoise.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I will never be your vichyssoise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Orgasms, why can women have them? Yep?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. I'm not a lawyer, but I don't think this is the place to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sometimes I imagine what it would be like to be a woman. I have a full-length mirror in my bathroom, and before I get dressed I will tuck myself between my legs just to see. And, um, it's uncomfortable. So maybe I do understand.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [sings] We're going to the mall. Bye Ryan, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Lets go, fall out, let's go. Move, move, move, move, move.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got shotgun. Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Let me be clear. There's only one thing that's important to me, and its not friendship. Its dominance, and I think I know a thing or two about dominating. Okay, I lived with a dominatrix for three years in Stamford. Mistress Lila. Taught me more than any college professor I ever had, while attending Cornell, which is where I went to school.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at that! Come on! Free underwear!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It is totally inappropriate, but on the other hand...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam, how bout something like that for you. Could sort of cover up any imperfections in the mid section. Just show off the twins a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's pretty cool.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You can make people believe anything. Today I made Dwight believe I like cold soups. Why? I don't know. I don't have to know. That's what makes me so dangerous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I learned a lot about women today. And any man who says he totally understands women is a fool. Because they are un-understandable. Jan and I broke up. Why? Because she didn't like one message I left on her voicemail? But that is her peariagative. I thought I understood women, but maybe, can't believe I'm gonna say this, maybe, women don't understand themselves.
